item.title: Tracking the coronavirus outbreak in Germany from March 2020
item.description:
Last modified: 2020-11-21. This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from the Robert Koch Institute. Data used from March 15, 2020 (not updated every day). For more extensive information about SARS-CoV-2 in Germany in English, see here.
Cumulative number of confirmed SARS-CoV-2 cases in Germany in linear scale since 100th case

item.title: Cases in all of Germany
item.description: Last modified: 2020-11-19. Cumulative number of confirmed SARS-CoV-2 cases in Germany in linear scale since March 15, 2020 Number of confirmed new cases in Germany since March 15, 2020 This plot shows the increase in the number of confirmed new cases. Each data point is averaged over 7 previous consecutive days . Note: This is not necessarily reflective in the increase of actual number of cases each day, since the number of tests for the virus has been increasing as the pandemic progressed.

item.title: Comparing Coronavirus Cases in the World
item.description:
Last modified: 2020-04-14. This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from ECDC. Data used from December 31, 2019-April 14, 2020 (not updated every day).
Doubling time for new cases and deaths I chose 10 countries to compare the rates of increase (in terms of doubling time) for the number of cases and the number of deaths, similar to the [NYT case growth rate visualization].
